page.lettertext:
fol.220r
Belgia 1594 28 July
Maye it please your good L: I reported in my last the 21
of this mo
n
eth
e aunswear of
e
States
to her
Ma
ties
demaunde
for their assistance by Sea: wherto I finde them by their
speeches very throughly disposed, and I doubt not at all of
their speedy perfourmance. They doe attend altogether upon
her Hig
es
precyse and finall resolution, without
e which they
will not make any present preparation, for
e reasons alleadged
in my former to your L: and because they sawe
at those dema
u
ds
which were delivered
M
r
Caron
, the 15 of this mo
n
eth were
then
e same daye counterma
n
ded againe: wherby remayning
uncertaine of her Ma
ties
intention, they know not how to frame
the course of their provision. Nevertheles I doe alwayes
assure them, that they shall have notice of it assoone as is
needfull. I am alsoe earnest with them not onely to doe
at
which was requyred of M
r
Caron, by those foresayd demaundes
but to extend
e particulars to some greater proportion, which I
am certainely persuaded, they will accomplishe in good sorte to her
Hig
es
contentation. Moreover I suppose,
at sith they have
determined as I am informed to reduce the newe Englishe companies,
at serve in their paye, to
e number of 8 ensignes, which were 13
at
e first, they maye be lykewise induced by her Ma
ties
intreatie, to
send them all towardes
Brest,
and to continue them there in
e
paye of these Contries, for
e tyme of
e enterprise. Which I signi-
fie to your L: as my privat persuasion, not omitting anie meanes
at I can use in
at regarde, or in any other
at I can learne, for
e advauncement of
e service.
And soe I take my humble leave
From
e Haghe. July 28
1594
